she and Debbie Wasserman Schultz recalled dinners and family vacations they'd taken with Gabrielle Giffords . That's when Gabrielle Giffords squeezed Kirsten Gillibrand 's hand and her right eye started to flicker, before finally opening wide. Debbie Wasserman Schultz says, it was like she was trying to will her eyes open, adding: "It felt like we were watching a miracle." Gabrielle Giffords ' other eye was damaged in the shooting and remains bandaged.( Copyright 2011 by The Associated Press.

Donald Rumsfeld 's paper was given to the White House only two weeks after President Bush had approved a US military operation in Afghanistan directed against Osama bin Laden and the Taliban regime. Despite that decision, Donald Rumsfeld 's proposal called explicitly for postponing indefinitely US airstrikes and the use of ground forces in support of the anti-Taliban Northern Alliance in order to try to catch Osama bin Laden . the Donald Rumsfeld paper argued that the US should target states that had supported anti-Israel forces such as Hezbollah and Hamas. host David Letterman underwent emergency heart surgery in 2000 and chatted candidly with Barbara Walters about his feelings of joy following the operation. But they didn't last long. During the chat, David Letterman stated, Depression is a Bill Clinton hole... I've dabbled in it. "There's a difference in being sad and being blue and being depressed and being chemically or clinically depressed. I do know the difference between those and it's horrifying. "Without some kind of medicinal help... institutions used to be full of people who were depressed.
